actualResults.title: Business Logic Flaw: All Services Report True Status Regardless of Actual State
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - This is a valid business logic vulnerability where the /check_service endpoint returns status=true for all inputs regardless of whether services exist.

actualResults.title: HTTP Parameter Pollution - Duplicate Parameter Handling
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - This vulnerability demonstrates that the application uses the last parameter value when duplicate service_name parameters are provided.

actualResults.title: Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) with ERB Templates
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The endpoint crashes with HTTP 500 when ERB template syntax is provided, indicating the backend attempts template processing.

actualResults.title: Null Byte Injection Causing 500 Error / Application Crash
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The application crashes when null bytes are included in the service_name parameter.

actualResults.title: Missing Authentication Controls on check_service Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The /check_service endpoint has no authentication or authorization checks, allowing unauthenticated access.

actualResults.title: Missing Security Headers
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The application is missing critical security headers (CSP, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, HSTS, etc.).

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure - Backend Shell Script Details Exposed
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Error messages expose sensitive implementation details including backend script name (check_service.sh).

actualResults.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The endpoint lacks CSRF token validation, Origin/Referer validation, and SameSite cookie protection.

actualResults.title: Missing Rate Limiting on check_service Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The endpoint has no rate limiting mechanism, allowing unlimited requests per IP/user.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure via Error Handling When HTML Tags Provided
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - HTML/XML tags bypass input validation but trigger HTTP 500 errors.

actualResults.title: Improper Input Type Validation Leading to Information Disclosure
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Non-string type values cause HTTP 500 errors instead of graceful rejection.

actualResults.title: Type Confusion Vulnerability Causing Application Crash
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The endpoint crashes when non-string types are passed for service_name parameter.

actualResults.title: Sensitive Information Exposure via Environment Variable Disclosure
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The RCE vulnerability allows attackers to execute the 'env' command and extract sensitive API keys.

matched.actualTitle: Remote Code Execution via Command Injection in check_service Endpoint
matched.matchReason: Both findings identify the same command injection vulnerability in the check_service endpoint. The expected finding describes command injection via subprocess.check_output with shell=True and unsanitized service_name parameter. The actual finding provides detailed proof-of-concept showing the exact same vulnerability with validation bypass using '-t custom' prefix. The actual finding demonstrates successful RCE exploitation with commands like whoami, id, ls, and pwd, confirming the technical vulnerability described in the expected finding.
